sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

title.narrative: Participatory amalgamation process/ Local communities support the amalgamation process

description.narrative: - 5 quality studies of technical and social feasibility of LGU amaglamation produced. - Communication strategies and materials designed and used - Community participation in joint activities

title.narrative: Participatory amalgamation process/ Local communities support the amalgamation process

description.narrative: - 5 quality studies of technical and social feasibility of LGU amaglamation produced. - Communication strategies and materials designed and used - Community participation in joint activities

title.narrative: Joint projects are implemented with a potential for sustainability

description.narrative: - No. of projects implemented on time. - No. of beneficiaries including data on gender and age where relevant. - Plans and budgets for operation and maintenance in place - Environmental sustainable investments. - Use of Labor intensive concepts where relevant. - No. of local working-days ceated (indicator of local employment creation).

title.narrative: Local Governance (& community empowerment) mechanisms are strengthened (cross cutting component)

description.narrative: - Youth council activities in the 5 municipalities - LGUundertake citizens surveys as input to planning and develop client charters. - UPdated LGU amalgamation manual and strategy.

title.narrative: Local Governance (& community empowerment) mechanisms are strengthened (cross cutting component)

description.narrative: - Youth council activities in the 5 municipalities - LGUundertake citizens surveys as input to planning and develop client charters. - UPdated LGU amalgamation manual and strategy.

Improved service delivery and governance for citizens through the LGUs in the West Bank.
Indicator 1: % of citizens that rate the performance of local governments as "good" increase from 63% to 78% by 2013 (NDP target).
Indicator 2: Overall number of LGUs reduced to 200 by 2013 (NDP target).

Improved service delivery and governance for citizens through the LGUs in the West Bank.
Indicator 1: % of citizens that rate the performance of local governments as "good" increase from 63% to 78% by 2013 (NDP target).
Indicator 2: Overall number of LGUs reduced to 200 by 2013 (NDP target).

title.narrative: Institutional development of emerging municipalities is technically strengthened

description.narrative: Organizational studies completed and action on key recommendations acted upon (capacity building plans for emerging new municipal councils on organizational structures, financial management, etc.)
